title: Disjoint Set (Union-Find)
description: A disjoint set is a data structure that keeps track of a partition of a set into disjoint (non-overlapping) subsets. Supports efficient union and find operations.
keyPoints: Supports union and find in nearly constant time.
Used in Kruskal's algorithm, connected components, etc.
Often implemented with path compression and union by rank.

techniques.title: Union by Rank & Path Compression
techniques.codeSnippet: function find(x) { if (parent[x] !== x) parent[x] = find(parent[x]); return parent[x]; } function union(x, y) { parent[find(x)] = find(y); }
